Text.Value: The singer keeps telling us that if we're good and quiet, we'll all be safe.
I couldn't get the idol you asked about.
Just another fairy tale though, isn't it?
Take it up with Asharak. Apparently I'm 'too young' to fight on the wall.
What? I've said thank you. Should I write you a poem, too?
Always a deal to be done - even now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Casually referring to the impending battle.

Text.Value: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

Text.Value: Fine. Take it.
If you honestly believe that, maybe it's best you hide down here with the other children.
If any of your stuff goes missing, just let me know. You're family now.
Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

Text.Value: Listening to stories - I think you're a little old for them. Or are you looking for a place to hide when the end comes?
Brave words when you're hiding down here with the rest of us. Listening to stories and waiting for the end like the rest of the children?
Zaki told me about you, toad-lady. Your kind scared Zorru real bad.
Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

Text.Value: Leave.
Yes? I've got places to be - I'm sure you do, too.
You're a little old for story-time. Looking for a place to hide when the end comes?
Come to say your goodbyes before the end comes? Wish I could fight with you.
Mirkon keeps telling the other kids they'll all be safe if they stay hidden.
Doesn't matter. The fight will come to us, no matter what he says.
The end's not coming today. I promise.
Somebody stole the idol. If I find out who it was... I'll recruit 'em.

EditorData.NodeContext: exasperated on first line, as she tells us something we gave her was stolen. Beat before final phrase and delivered with a smile - it's a fun line but she's serious about recruiting good thieves
EditorData.logicalname: Gave Idol | Mol doesn't have it.

Text.Value: Still here? The smart ones ran a long while back.
Take it up with Zevlor. Apparently I'm 'too young' to fight on the wall.
I'm looking to trade.
Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.
But... I'm glad you did.

EditorData.NodeContext: hesitant thanks relieved but doesn't want to admit it -  she just survived a battle  thanks to us

Text.Value: Here - the idol you wanted.
You were stupid to come back.

EditorData.NodeContext: relieved but doesn't want to admit it - we 'came back' to help in a battle that she just survived thanks to us

Text.Value: Are you any good with those knives? We need every blade.
Try not to die up there.
You're never too old for stories. The plots just get a bit more... complicated.
Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

Text.Value: Your kind scare easily.
Quiet, hatchling. What are you doing down here?
You look a little old for this yourself.
Tough - I'm keeping it.
I don't have the idol you were after.
Some advice - if you want something, don't ask. Just take.
You do good work. If you can handle more than goblins, might be I'll have use of you in Baldur's Gate.

Synopsis: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
